title: Regulation No 87/64/EEC of the Commission of 15 July 1964 amending the common quality standards for onions
header:
REGULATION No 87/64/EEC OF THE COMMISSION of 15 July 1964 amending the common quality standards for onions
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN ECONOMIC COMMUNITY
main_body:
Sections I, III, IV (B) and VI (D) of Annex 11/6 to Regulation No 23 shall be amended as shown in the Annex to this Regulation with effect from 1 August 1964.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 15 July 1964.
For the Commission
The President
Walter HALLSTEIN  1 OJ No 30, 20.4.1962, p. 965/62.
ANNEX AMENDMENTS TO THE COMMON QUALITY STANDARDS FOR ONIONS
I. Section I, "Definition of Produce" shall be amended as follows:
"This standard applies to onions of the Allium cepa L. variety to be supplied to the consumer in the natural State and excludes green onions with full leaves and onions for processing."
II. Section III, "Sizing" shall be amended as follows:
"The onions must be graded for size. Sizing is determined by the maximum diameter of the same equatorial section.
The difference between the diameters of the smallest and the largest onions in the same package must not exceed:      - 5 mm where the diameter of the smallest onion is between 10 mm and 20 mm
- 15 mm where the diameter of the smallest onion is between 20 mm and 40 mm
- 20 mm where the diameter of the smallest onion is 40 mm or over.
The minimum diameter is 10 mm."
III. Section IV (B), "Size tolerances" shall be amended as follows:
"10 % by weight of onions not conforming to the size specified but with a diameter of not more than 20 % below or above it."
IV. In Section VI (D), "Commercial specifications" the following shall be added after the word "size":
"indicated by minimum and maximum diameters".
